questions.question: Q1. Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS) primarily measures:

answers.a: Impedance as a function of frequency.
answers.b: Current as a function of time.
answers.c: Potential as a function of time.
answers.d: Charge as a function of potential.

questions.question: Q2. In a Nyquist plot, the diameter of the semicircle corresponds to:
Q3. Changing the working electrode material mainly affects:

answers.b: Charge transfer resistance and interfacial behavior.

questions.question: Q4. A typical electrochemical impedance experimental setup consists of an electrochemical cell, a potentiostat/galvanostat, and _____________.
Q5. Which of the following electrodes is necessary to close the electrical circuit in an electrochemical cell?
Q6. _______________ is the total opposition offered by a RL series circuit?
Q7. The ferricyanide/ferrocyanide redox couple is commonly used in EIS because it:

answers.b: Has low solubility in aqueous media.
answers.c: Shows fast and well-defined electron transfer kinetics.

questions.question: Q8. Impedance is the ratio of:
